intro: Paranephelius ovatus, commonly known as the oval leaf mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that attaches to the branches of its host trees. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its simple, ovate-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Its berries, which are usually red or orange, contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Paranephelius ovatus is often found in tropical and subtropical regions where it thrives on a variety of host trees.
